content.description:
This fun route ascends a steep roof section to a techy slab. Start on the bolts just left of the

8,9,10

start, gain the ledge, and continue up the steep roof above. Gain another ledge, clip a couple bolts and trend left to finish on Empire of Dirt.

This is one of the easier .11s at the Pool Wall, and it is a worthy pitch. Start up

8,9,10

, but at the second tier, go straight up at the cactus. There are two options at the crux, one follows a weakness into tiny holds and nearly a dead end, and an easier option traverses into good but hard to find holds.

This is a great arete climb. Originally there was one route that crossed the arete, Ginsu Arete. It was recently rebolted with routes on both sides of the arete. Look Sharp is the [left], and easier, side. Moderate climbing leads up crack, head out left to clip a bolt that is just a bit further away than you'd like (you can place a cam before the bolt if desired). The right side of arete is

Be Sharp

.
content.protection: A handful of draws, chain anchor.
content.location:
It is on the obvious arete at the right side of the

Bay of Pigs

sector, just right of a wide/thin corner. Turn the arete to the left side after the first bolt.

content.description:
Start off ledge with

Bay of Pigs

to the left and

Breaking Waves

to the right.  Climb 2-3 bolts to below a roof. Make a reachy clip at the lip of roof.  Climb slightly left of roof for the crux move and make the clip which leads to easier ground.  The bolt above the roof at crux has recently been moved into a better position due to hold breakage. Previously clipping the bolt was the crux.
content.location: This is on a ledge 25 feet off deck, which can be gained via 3rd class to right or left side of ledge.

content.description:
This is just a cool link-up. Start on

Gay Rodeo

, after clipping the bolt at the crux, go "straight" up and finish on

Bay of Pigs

. Keeps the grade consistent all the way instead of easing after the crux.
content.location:
Start from the ledge crossing the Backyard portion of the Pool Wall. See

Gay Rodeo

/

Bay of Pigs

for more details.

content.description: Clip two bolts to gain the large ledge. Step left to a weakness through the overhang. The first crux is moving through the next three bolts. Climb the lower angle featured face above. The redpoint crux is at the last bolt if you are 5'8" or shorter. A tenuous slabby step up will get you to large holds just below the anchor.
content.protection:
It has approximately 10 bolts. This shares a top anchor with

Squeeze Job

and

8, 9, 10

.
content.location:
This is the bolted line just left of

Squeeze Job

.

content.description:
This route is the BoP Open Project described in Jason Nelson's excellent "

Climbs of the Million Dollar Highway

." It's a great addition to the Pool Wall with surprisingly good stone where it counts and engaging, powerful movement. The business is a pair of stretchy boulder problems up the prow, split by an unusual clipping "jug."

Thanks to Luke for the vision, effort, and hardware!
content.location: On theÂ far left end of the Bay of Pigs wall, between Cable Crack and Choss Factor, climbing the leaning prow.

content.description:
This is a variation, start up

Bay of Pigs

and climb all the way up to the crux 9 bolts up and crimp left past two more bolts, after clipping the last bolt head back right to the

Bay of Pigs

anchor. An independent anchor is coming soon.
content.location: Start off of the access ledge that runs across the Backyard section of the Pool Wall.

content.description: This is a great route with a funky, stand-up crux sequence. Get into the underclings and grab some grips then huck to a jug. Crimpy climbing leads up for 5 or so more bolts.
content.location:
Access the ledge that runs across the

Bay of Pigs

, and Breaking the Waves is the second route from the right side.

content.description:
This is a great tech-arete. Originally there was one route that crossed the arete, Ginsu Arete. It was recently rebolted with routes on both sides of the arete. Be Sharp is the right, and harder, side. Moderate climbing leads up to the bolts (a cam or two can protect the start). Climb the arete to a friction dependent crux move with a foot dyno! It is great during cooler temps, frustrating when warm. The left side of arete is

Look Sharp

.
content.protection: A handful of draws, chain anchor.
content.location:
This is on the obvious arete at the right side of the

Bay of Pigs

sector, just right of a wide/thin corner.

content.description: Begin by pulling a mini-roof, and make a hard high step at first bolt.  This then leads to easier ground that stays to the left side of the larger roof. The redpoint crux comes at the last 2-3 bolts with tricky dihedral climbing that finishes on a good hold.
content.location:
This is one route to the left of

Gay Rodeo

.  Start off the ledge 25 feet up, which can be gained via 3rd class the left or right side of ledge.

content.description: Climb past two bolts to a ledge then up the left side of the square shaped cut in the rock. Continue up the crux, obtuse dihedral with a black right wall, then tackle the thin slab to the anchors.
content.location: It is the leftmost route that starts on the short face below the ledge.

content.description: This is a really popular route, despite the fact that it climbs through two large ledges. It has a circuitous nature to it: clip three bolts on the right-most of three close-together starts. Surmount the ledge and head right to a reachy clip above a roof. Pull the roof on a flake, clip the next bolt, and unclip the previous bolt to ease drag. At the cactus, head left, and finish up a left-facing corner.
